qas.question: What did the prospective owner of the paper promise?
How did the prospective publisher describe the newspaper he would produce?
Which party would the newspaper endorse?
What was the price paid for the newspaper?
Whose offer to buy the paper was turned down?

context: Seizing the opportunity to increase his presence on Fleet Street, he made an agreement with the print unions, promising <a0_0>fewer redundancies<a0_0/> if he acquired the newspaper. He assured IPC that he would publish <a1_0>a "straightforward, honest newspaper"<a1_0/> which would continue to support <a2_0>Labour<a2_0/>. IPC, under pressure from the unions, rejected <a4_0>Maxwell's offer<a4_0/>, and Murdoch bought the paper for <a3_0>£800,000<a3_0/>, to be paid in instalments. He would later remark: "I am constantly amazed at the ease with which I entered British newspapers."
